name: Cassino (Madeira)
description: A traditional Madeiran card game where players capture cards from the table using matching values or combinations. Strategy and memory are key to securing high-value cards and outscoring your opponent.
basicRules: Deal 4 cards to each player and 4 cards face-up to the table.
Players take turns playing one card per round.
Capture cards from the table by matching their value or summing cards to equal the played card's value.
Players may 'build' combinations on the table that can be captured in future turns.
If no capture or build is possible, the player must 'trail' a card onto the table.
Repeat dealing until the deck is exhausted; the last player to make a capture takes remaining table cards.
Score at the end of each round based on captured cards.
winningCondition: Game is played until one player or team reaches a target score (commonly 21 or 31 points).
variants: Team Play: In 4-player games, partners sit opposite each other.
No Builds: Beginners may skip build rules for simpler gameplay.
Target Score Variant: Increase to 51 or 61 for longer games.
strategyTips: Track which high-point cards have been played or captured.
Use builds wisely; don't leave them open for opponents to steal.
Controlling the last capture can secure leftover cards and extra points.
Focus on capturing the 10 of Diamonds and 2 of Spades when possible.
